claim: The badge obtained by the top-reputation cohort is Epic.
extra_info: highest reputation refers to Max(Reputation); user refers to UserId
reasoning: The user with the highest reputation (87,393, UserId 919) does not have the 'Epic' badge. The 'Epic' badge belongs to UserId 805, who has a reputation of 65,272 — not the maximum. Therefore, the claim that the top-reputation user obtained the Epic badge is contradicted by the data.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me first explore the database schema, then query the relevant data.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

tool_use_result.stdout:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

content.content:
CREATE TABLE users
(
    Id              INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    Reputation      INTEGER          null,
    CreationDate    DATETIME     null,
    DisplayName     TEXT null,
    LastAccessDate  DATETIME     null,
    WebsiteUrl      TEXT null,
    Location        TEXT null,
    AboutMe         TEXT     null,
    Views           INTEGER          null,
    UpVotes         INTEGER          null,
    DownVotes       INTEGER          null,
    AccountId       INTEGER          null,
    Age             INTEGER          null,
    ProfileImageUrl TEXT null
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE users
(
    Id              INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    Reputation      INTEGER          null,
    CreationDate    DATETIME     null,
    DisplayName     TEXT null,
    LastAccessDate  DATETIME     null,
    WebsiteUrl      TEXT null,
    Location        TEXT null,
    AboutMe         TEXT     null,
    Views           INTEGER          null,
    UpVotes         INTEGER          null,
    DownVotes       INTEGER          null,
    AccountId       INTEGER          null,
    Age             INTEGER          null,
    ProfileImageUrl TEXT null
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE badges
(
    Id     INTEGER          not null
        primary key,
    UserId INTEGER          null,
    Name   TEXT null,
    Date   DATETIME     null,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE badges
(
    Id     INTEGER          not null
        primary key,
    UserId INTEGER          null,
    Name   TEXT null,
    Date   DATETIME     null,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: Now let me find the user with the highest reputation and check their badges.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT u.Id, u.Reputation, b.Name FROM users u JOIN badges b ON u.Id = b.UserId WHERE u.Reputation = (SELECT MAX(Reputation) FROM users);"
input.description: Find badges for the user with the highest reputation

content.text: The user with the highest reputation (87393) has many badges. Let me check specifically if "Epic" is among them:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT b.Name FROM badges b JOIN users u ON b.UserId = u.Id WHERE u.Reputation = (SELECT MAX(Reputation) FROM users) AND b.Name = 'Epic';"
input.description: Check if user with max reputation has Epic badge

content.text: No results — the user with the highest reputation does **not** have the "Epic" badge. Let me also verify that "Epic" exists as a badge anywhere in the database:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM badges WHERE Name = 'Epic';"
input.description: Check if Epic badge exists anywhere

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT b.UserId, u.Reputation FROM badges b JOIN users u ON b.UserId = u.Id WHERE b.Name = 'Epic';"
input.description: Find who has the Epic badge and their reputation

content.text:
The "Epic" badge exists in the database but belongs to user 805 with reputation 65,272. The user with the **highest** reputation (87,393, user 919) does not have the "Epic" badge. The claim states that the badge obtained by the top-reputation user is "Epic," which is contradicted by the data.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The user with the highest reputation (87,393, UserId 919) does not have the 'Epic' badge. The 'Epic' badge belongs to UserId 805, who has a reputation of 65,272 — not the maximum. Therefore, the claim that the top-reputation user obtained the Epic badge is contradicted by the data."}
```
